00030 #ifndef _VERBOSE_H
00031 #define _VERBOSE_H
00032 
00033 #include <assert.h>
00034 #include <fstream>
00035 #include <iostream>
00036 #include <string>
00037 #include <vector>
00038 #include "ProgressHandler.h"
00039 #include "ProgressDot.h"
00040 #include "MsgHandler.h"
00041 #include "MsgStream.h"
00042 
00047 class Verbose {
00048 
00049 public:
00053   class Param {
00054 
00055   public: 
00056     Param(ProgressHandler *progHandler, MsgHandler *msgHandler, MsgHandler *warnHandler) {
00057       m_Verbosity = 1;
00058       m_DotMod = 10;
00059       m_DotCount = 0;
00060       m_NewLine = true;
00061       m_ProHandler.push_back(progHandler);
00062       m_MsgHandler.push_back(msgHandler);
00063       m_WarnHandler.push_back(warnHandler);
00064     }
00065 
00066     std::vector<ProgressHandler *> m_ProHandler; 
00067     std::vector<MsgHandler *> m_MsgHandler; 
00068     std::vector<MsgHandler *> m_WarnHandler; 
00069     bool m_NewLine;   
00070     int m_Verbosity;  
00071     int m_DotMod;     
00072     int m_DotCount;   
00073   };
00074   
00080   static Param &getParam() {
00081     // Avoid weird windows .NET/Forms bug where linking to cout/cerr can cause problems...
00082   #ifdef _WINDOWS 
00083     static ProgressDot progHandler(0, NULL);
00084     static MsgStream  msgHandler(0, NULL);
00085   #else
00086     // Normal console mode is ok.
00087     static ProgressDot progHandler(1, &std::cerr);
00088     static MsgStream msgHandler(1, &std::cerr);
00089   #endif
00090     // By default we just use a normal message handler as the warning handler.
00091     static Param m_Param(&progHandler, &msgHandler, &msgHandler);
00092     return m_Param;
00093   }
00094 
00096   static void pushProgressHandler(ProgressHandler *handler) {
00097     getParam().m_ProHandler.push_back(handler);
00098   }
00099 
00100   static void popProgressHandler() {
00101     getParam().m_ProHandler.pop_back();
00102   }
00103 
00104   static void pushMsgHandler(MsgHandler *handler) {
00105     getParam().m_MsgHandler.push_back(handler);
00106   }
00107 
00108   static void popMsgHandler() {
00109     getParam().m_MsgHandler.pop_back();
00110   }
00111 
00112   static void pushWarnHandler(MsgHandler *handler) {
00113     getParam().m_WarnHandler.push_back(handler);
00114   }
00115 
00116   static void popWarnHandler() {
00117     getParam().m_WarnHandler.pop_back();
00118   }
00119 
00120   static void progressBegin(int verbosity, const std::string &msg, int total, int dotMod, int maxCalls) {
00121     std::vector<ProgressHandler *> &m_Handle = getParam().m_ProHandler;
00122     getParam().m_DotMod = dotMod;
00123     getParam().m_DotCount = 0;
00124     // if we have handlers let them know we're beginning.
00125     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Handle.size(); i++) {
00126       ProgressHandler *handle = m_Handle[i];
00127       if(handle->handleAll()) 
00128         handle->progressBegin(verbosity, msg, maxCalls);
00129       else
00130         handle->progressBegin(verbosity, msg, total);
00131     }
00132   }
00133   
00134   static void progressStep(int verbosity);
00135 
00136   static void progressEnd(int verbosity, const std::string &msg) {
00137     Param &p = getParam();
00138     if(verbosity <= p.m_Verbosity) {
00139       for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_ProHandler.size(); i++) {
00140         p.m_ProHandler[i]->progressEnd(verbosity, msg);
00141       }
00142     }
00143   }
00144 
00150   static void setLevel(int level) {
00151     Param &p = getParam();
00152     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_ProHandler.size(); i++) {
00153       p.m_ProHandler[i]->setBaseVerbosity(level);
00154     }
00155     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_MsgHandler.size(); i++) {
00156       p.m_MsgHandler[i]->setBaseVerbosity(level);
00157     }
00158   }
00159 
00166   static void out(int level, const std::string &s, bool nl = true) {
00167     Param &p = getParam();
00168     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_MsgHandler.size(); i++) {
00169       p.m_MsgHandler[i]->message(level, s, nl);
00170     }
00171   }
00172 
00179   static void warn(int level, const std::string &s, bool nl = true, const std::string prefix = "\nWARNING: ") {
00180     Param &p = getParam();
00181     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_WarnHandler.size(); i++) {
00182       p.m_WarnHandler[i]->message(level, prefix + s, nl);
00183     }
00184   }
00185 
00186 };
